title: rustc internal compiler error: bad placeholder type

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
The following code causes a compiler crash:

```rust
extern crate spin;

fn main() {
    static SINGLETON_STATIC: spin::Once<_> = spin::Once::new();
    SINGLETON_STATIC.call_once(|| 0u32);
}
```

Replacing `spin::Once<_>` with `spin::Once<u32>` works properly.

Rust version:
```
rustc 1.42.0-nightly (859764425 2020-01-07)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 85976442558bf2d09cec3aa49c9c9ba86fb15c1f
commit-date: 2020-01-07
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.42.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0
```

Full output:
```

  |         ^^^^ help: consider prefixing with an underscore: `_bar1`
```
